Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Patient ID: [REDACTED]
Date of procedure: [REDACTED]
Attending physician: Dr. G. Ahmed
Assistants: Interventional pulmonology fellow; bronchoscopy nurse; radiology technologist.

Pre-procedure diagnosis: Two synchronous lung nodules: 14 mm right upper lobe posterior segment and 11 mm right lower lobe superior segment, both PET-avid, in a patient with COPD and limited pulmonary reserve.
Post-procedure diagnosis: Same.
Indication: Staged local ablation of multifocal early lung cancers in a nonsurgical candidate.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.5 mm endotracheal tube; ASA class III.

Procedures performed:
1. Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy with cone-beam CT guidance.
2. Transbronchial microwave ablation of right upper lobe posterior segment nodule using Emprint catheter.
3. Transbronchial microwave ablation of right lower lobe superior segment nodule using Emprint catheter.

Procedure description: After induction, navigation bronchoscopy targeted the right upper lobe lesion first. A CrossCountry needle and extended working channel were positioned into the lesion and a single 8-minute ablation was delivered. Cone-beam CT confirmed an adequate ablation zone with an estimated 5 mm margin. The catheter and bronchoscope were then redirected to the right lower lobe superior segment. Following similar navigation and tract creation, a 6-minute ablation was delivered to the smaller lesion. A combined cone-beam CT demonstrated discrete ablation zones covering both nodules without overlap and without pleural disruption.

Estimated blood loss: <10 mL.
Complications: None immediate.
Disposition: Extubated in the operating room and admitted overnight given bilateral parenchymal treatment in a single session; follow-up CT arranged at 3 months to assess both ablation sites.
